title.narrative: Utilities - Sewerage (A). Assessments and Taxes - Assessments and Miscellaneous Taxes. Utilities - Garbage and Trash Disposal and/or NOC (A). Utilities - Electricity (A). Utilities - Water (A). Utilities - Water. Utilities - Sewerage. Utilities - Garbage and Trash Disposal and/or NOC

description.narrative: Reduce the transmission and impact of HIV/AIDS through support for prevention, care and treatment programs.

This award strives to reduce the transmission and impact of HIVAIDS through support for prevention, care and treatment programs. More specifically, this includes EXECUTIVE DIRECTION[Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.. EXECUTIVE DIRECTION[Payments of assessments and miscellaneous taxes, not otherwise classified (NOC).]. Utilities[Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. EXECUTIVE DIRECTION Utilities[Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. Utilities[Payments of assessments and miscellaneous taxes, not otherwise classified (NOC).]. EXECUTIVE DIRECTION Utilities[Payments of assessments and miscellaneous taxes, not otherwise classified (NOC).]. Payments of assessments and miscellaneous taxes, not otherwise classified (NOC)..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: South Africa continues to be an important strategic partner of the United States. Although it is the second largest economy in Africa, South Africa struggles with serious socioeconomic challenges, including HIV/AIDS and other health concerns, mass unemployment, a failing education system, increasing corruption, poor accountability, and critical levels of violent crime. As South Africa continues to exert leadership in the region, it is working with the United States and other donors to address its social and economic challenges. U.S. investments, in line with South African national development priorities, will target efforts where funding can catalyze innovative approaches for reform and improve efficiency, helping South Africa sustain its democracy and improve the lives of its people
